description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tg6v","text":"Purpose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62k7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kvrb","text":"Blood agar is agar base enriched with 5% blood. It is an enriched medium often used to grow fastidious organisms and to differentiate bacteria based on their hemolytic properties.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tmd9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsnn1","text":"Key concepts","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tar6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j1fo","text":"The agar base can vary – Brucella is what is generally prefered for the growth of diverse vaginal organisms, but Casman and Columbia have also been used and shown to support a broad variety of organisms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpi7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95ha3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"fsgf7","text":"Supplies                                                                                ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s8bb","text":"Agar base (can be media base already containing agar, or liquid media base to which you add the agar separately)                                                                               ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brgqk","text":"Distilled water                                                                  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ert6","text":"Glass media bottles                                                           ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9toem","text":"Blood (we usually use defibrinated sheep blood that is less than 1 month old)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u58i","text":"Sterile Petri dishes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47kac","text":"25 mL serological pipet   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s0if","text":"Serological pipettor                                                    ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"157g5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1kpe","text":"Equipments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kjhb","text":"Autoclave","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2tce","text":"Water bath","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kndf","text":"Bunsen burner","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c861k","text":"Stir plate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8mp76","text":"Pick up media from downstairs shortly after run completes (they should place it in a    incubator downstairs after the run). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e4o8l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ktov","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43l9","text":"Place in   water bath for 20-30 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cecta","text":"Media is ready to pour when bottle is warm, but not hot to the touch.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgsuq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ln3m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at064","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3468CA00E8DA11EC91D19324C1FF0727","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"55","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4lqcd","text":"**Remember to bring thermal gloves with you when you go downstairs to retrieve your media from the incubator. It may still be hot!!","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"40F31C90CD6811ECBF577D0D0C1A784C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"55","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e36om","text":"Mix blood (at room temperature) by gently swirling (rubbing the bottle between your hands works well).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch9ok","text":"Prepare plates and pouring area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3ov2","text":"Clear and clean area of bench near Bunsen burner.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"luhd","text":"Arrange sterile plates right side up in small stacks of 4-5.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nu57","text":"Stripe plates if desired.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"airjl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eh00g","text":"Bring blood, a   serological pipet, and the serological pipettor to the media making area (stir plate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c123a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"82A352F0CD6711ECBF577D0D0C1A784C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1dna6","text":"Remove 1 bottle of media from water bath and place on stir plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9vmr","text":"While media is being stirred, pipet   of blood into   of media (final concentration of )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":52,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"47c9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"8B4C9420CD6711ECBF577D0D0C1A784C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"8E0105C0CD6711ECBF577D0D0C1A784C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"B038C9C0CD6711ECBF577D0D0C1A784C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4drpe","text":"Move to pouring area and pour plates immediately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65s08","text":"Flame lip of bottle at the start of each stack of plates.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9aue","text":"When bottle is empty, carefully flame plates to remove bubbles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"316n9","text":"Gently push plates to back of bench (away from Bunsen burner hose) to solidify and then clean up bench and rinse the media bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e87ke","text":"All papers and pipets with blood on them get disposed in the yellow biohazard waste bin (near fume hood).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"31s3u","text":"Prepare to pour second batch of plates if needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj1rj","text":"Mix appropriate amount of agar base into distilled water in a glass media bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnccg","text":"  agar in a 1 L bottle makes ~25 plates.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2936v","text":"Each bottle of powdered media lists the grams of powdered media needed for 1 L of media. Use half this amount for 500 mL.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eseq5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t01a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"76046D90CD6711ECBF577D0D0C1A784C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnmtd","text":"Stir media with stir bar until completely dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhul5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dbju7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7vg01","text":"Leave the stir bar in the bottle during autoclaving.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c57b","text":"Autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7ani","text":"For 1 or 2 bottles of Brucella agar media, autoclave for 15 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mpu3","text":"For 3 or more bottles of Brucella agar media, autoclave for 30 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72pmm","text":"For Columbia agar media, autoclave for 45 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o7ob","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f15m8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":30,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7e6ck","text":"**Be sure to label the bottle and the autoclavable pan with 'Agar' and requested autoclave time ('15 minutes'). Also can be helpful if you add ~1 inch of water to the bottom of the pan (they won't always do this for you).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5rfk","text":"After dropping off downstairs for autoclaving, turn water bath on and set to   . Remove blood from refrigerator and allow to warm on the bench.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":77,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"61uiq","text":"Check and make sure no one else needs water bath at lower temperature for the next 1-2 hours.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9g65r","text":"Use the freshest blood available and generally do not use blood that is over 1 month old.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7jcf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"32C8DC40CD6811ECBF577D0D0C1A784C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"55","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9nce","text":"Completely finish with one batch of plates before removing a second bottle from water bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2upu1","text":"Do not add blood to second bottle and then put back into water bath – carry out the pouring procedure from start to finish 1 bottle at a time.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Making Blood Agar Plates
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"6c8s7","text":"Wear a regular (fabric) lab coat when you pour plates. This helps ensure your sleeves/clothing won't become soiled with blood and won't come into contact with the Bunsen burner flame. Tie long hair back.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
